Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, with good location.”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthTim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night as only 2 days in Rome, found it via a website and after reading through various comments,which were mixed reviews, decided to go for this hotel. It was an average price,near the terminal station,5 minute walk,there is also a metro station not too far away as well,the Citysightseeing Rome tour also start near to the terminal,passing one of the stops on the walk to the hotel. The hotel was easy to find. I checked in and went to room,it did look like they still had to finish cleaning the bathroom,when I came back from a walk it was cleaned. There was a safe in room for valuables which don't need to pay for too. The room was comfortable,just what you need,the breakfast was enough, to fill you up for the day,the power shower was great, too so what more do you want? I would certainly stay here again and would recommend the hotel as an ideal base if you are a tourist here for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Food Poisoning...Vomiting 2 days & Diarrhea 6 days”
Reviews.Author: EMSid
Reviews.Content: Trip to Rome was terrible because of this hotel. 1st day I had pasta and clams at this hotel (the only thing I ate) & was sick within a couple of hours. It lasted 6 days, two trips to the pharmacy & a trip to the emergency room as soon as I returned home. It was located next to a XXXX Movie place and a NO LIMITS bar. The Do Not Disturb Sign means nothing, they still come in (twice) and if you need something you'll have to call the front desk 3 or more times (hangers & toilet tissue) There is no shower, it's a hand held spray hose. The A/C doesn't work so the windows must stay open so you can hear car alarms going off all day and night. SAVE YOUR MONEY.....find another place to stay. By the time you pay for all the meds $30, the emergency room $75, the $1300 X 3 for the flights (husband & sister too) and $300 in tour tickets, it's not a good deal. Use the money to stay at a nice hotel and enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - not a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lala939
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews from trip advisor. I did not feel it was a great location to visit all the attractions as it was too far out and I love walking! Yes it is fairly near the Termini but you do get alot of hassle there. The beds were not comfortable - too hard. The hot breakfast always seemed cold not matter what time we arrived, likewise the tea and coffee even though it was freshly made. Noisy during the night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay With Wonderfully Attentive Staff Can't Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: MisterAnthony
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Art Deco for 10 nights with my wife. This hotel is wonderful. The staff was attentive respectful professional as well as personable. Any special needs we had were addressed to more than our expectations. I can clearly say the staff at the hotel was happy to have us as guests and knew what the word hospitality means. I was extremely satisfied with the service. The hotel is beautifully decorated, impeccably clean. It gives a great feel of romance when you walk up the grand art deco staircase, a decor with a wonderful feel of the romantic 20's and 30's. The room we had was large spacious with a wonderful outdoor patio, large bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. The room also had a living room area and terrific spacious closet. I was very impressed with the carful attention to details. The maid service surprised us daily. She would not only do the usual cleaning but each day would leave something special. Flowers on the bed. Goodies to snack on. A surprise extra touch which made out stay even more lovely. The restaurant staff in the hotel would go above and beyond. My wife has celiac disease, a wheat allergy. A problem for the best restaurants. This staff not only was careful to provide gluten free meals but went out of their way to get supplies of gluten free foods especially for my wife. The location is great, close to all but not with the super expensive prices. Only a few blocks walk to Termini station which give you access to the entire citly. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Djanaba
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel rooms have everyhting you need the staff and service they provide does not make it worth staying here. It is not convenient to any major tourist spots except the Termini and there you are just harrassed non stop. The front desk made sure that you knew you were an inconvenience and bothering them. The breakfast was terrible. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: Nick13658
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel. Lovely decor - great attention to detail. 15 min walk to many sites. 2 mins from bus routes, 5 mins from tube or tram. Arrive 11am - were told check was at 2pm but we could leave our cases - which was fine. After taking our details he rang housekeeping and told us the room would be ready in an hour. We asked if we could wait and have a coffee - he furnished complimentary coffee and croissants - and by the time we had finished the room was ready (15 mins). Breakfasts were plentiful and as expected for the continent. Nice Wine bar and restaurants in the area. Bed was firm - but I like that. There was a little late night noise from a local disco - but hey - it was generally quiet for a city hotel. I would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “A bustling artsy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NonRevLuv
Reviews.Content: This was a popular hotel especially for off-season – we were only able to book 2 nights as it was fully booked for the rest of the week. The room was tasteful – a clean fresh modern look with hints of retro. I really appreciated the detail they put into the décor – although perhaps they can update the television as that was the only piece that felt out of place. The front desk staff was extremely polite and helpful, and there was a computer for use in the lobby and complimentary wifi in the room. The breakfast had a lot of variety (eggs, bacon, cheeses, pastries, etc.), and there was plenty of wait staff to keep the cappuccinos coming. I didn’t mind the location at all -- while it was a slightly longer jaunt to Termini, it was quite close to the Castro Pretorio Metro stop. There were plenty of food options nearby including fine dining, family style casual, pizzerias, and other ethnic foods. I felt like it was very safe to walk around, although there is a “sexy movie” cine on one of the side streets. If there were negatives, it was the stuff that couldn't be decorated. The heat was difficult to control in the room, so we had to keep the windows open. The shower stall was also pretty small, and the pressure/heat was not always consistent. I would recommend that you request a room with a tub.

Reviews.Title: “An artistic experience with superb personal service”
Reviews.Author: Gi0vanni
Reviews.Content: One of the advantages of this hotel is its location. Ten minutes walk from Termini Stazione and three minutes walk from a fermata that gives access to most of the linea of autobus leading to most of the tourist sites.With a 4euro biglietto giornatale that covers all autobus linea and metro treni sevices for a day, with the superb public transport network in Rome one is within easy access of every where for a bargain price and travelling time is minimal ( I am not certain that atac drivers feed in to Ferrari but I would not be surprised). The hotel has been treated to the sort of refurbishment that hints that no expense has been spared. I thought the reception area was impressive but when I saw the sitting room and the bedroom I was bowled over with the attention to detail. Wood strip flooring, contemperaneous telephones, radios and posters spoke of a love of period and a perfectionist outlook. The bedroom was slightly smaller than is consistent with the period but was immaculate and an artistic delight. Breakfast was well up in the quattri stelli class; all the usual continental selection plus scrambled eggs and bacon for the Inglesi who cannot bear to be parted from their home comforts and the coffee was really good with waitresses asking you what you wanted within at most two minutes of your sitting down. The breakfast room was spacious and one never had to wait for replenishment of the jugs or the baskets. Antonio , at reception, was delightful; ever ready to offer help, greet one cheerfully or even offer a small Italian lesson if one should ask. I f you like Art Deco, this hotel is worth a visit as an artistic heritage site; if not, the service and comfort makes a visit worthwhile anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and nicely presented rooms”
Reviews.Author: DrLSB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute stroll from Termini station and located in an area with plenty of convenience shops. The room was not huge but was nicely presented and clean. The shower was ok but not very powerful. The breakfast was very good with a wide selection on offer. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. I would definately stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Updated hotel, poor beds”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over New Years Eve Weekend. While the stay was not cheap, the rooms were clean, breakfast was good and for the most part, the hotel did not seem too crowded. Sleeping was a little more difficult since the walls sounded like they were paper thin and the bed was really hard. We made it work but I think we would stay somewhere else because of this the next time we are in Rome. Location wise, we really liked being a little further from the busy areas of Rome. There were a lot of great restaurants nearby and the area felt safe around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice theme hotel but location not as convenient”
Reviews.Author: anggingyin
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Best Western hotels in the vicinity, the location of Artdeco is not as convenient. It is about 15 minutes walk to Roma Termini and 10 minutes walk to Metro Line B. The distance will seem really far especially if you are carrying heavy luggage. It is located along the tail end of Via Pelestro so I will advised to get your directions right before arriving. We were given the wrong directions and spent almost 1 hour looking for the hotel. The hotel is located near an area of restaurants and eateries and if you are looking for a nice Italian meal, I would recommend Mamma's Angela which is also located along Via Pelestro. The whole theme of the hotel is Art and retro so it is quite nice, they also offered complimentary services such as free coffee/tea/water to room, international papers etc. The reception staff was friendly, usual of Italian hospitality. One complaint about the hotel, the walls are quite thin and we could hear our neighbors walking along the corridor. Do ask for a room NOT facing the road as it can get quite noisy at night with cars and ambulance siren. As for the buffet breakfast, the variety is OK but we got sick of the selection after 3 days. As the hotel was packed during the time we stayed, the dining staff was overwhelmed, as such they was not able to provide us with utensils, refill of food until we asked. There are actually a few Best Western hotels nearby, although Artdeco is not the best in terms of location, it makes for it for the theme of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RieBaggage
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations from the moment we arrived - we were allowed our room two hours early. The staff were friendly and helpful, the food was good and the decor nice. We ate dinner in the restaurant on our first night and the meal was tasty, although the vegetable buffet was (purposefully) cold. The hotel location is within walking distance of most landmarks, but we are keen walkers so some may prefer to travel by Metro, which has a station nearby. This cosy and welcoming hotel was perfect for us and offered fantastic value for money. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, pity about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Chrisnsteve76
Reviews.Content: Having deceided to goto Rome for the weekend, we opted to stay at the Hotel Artdeco. Here is a summery of our experience. We had quite an eartly morning flight. Upon booking the hotel, we requested an early check in. When we arrived at 11am, we were told in no uncertain terms that we would not be able to gain access to our room untill 2pm. As there was nothing we could do, we just headed out and found somewhere fr a spot of lunch. When we finally got into our room I have to say the stnadard really was good, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was clean and the docour was what one would expect from a hotel with the name Art Deco. The only thing we found, although amusing for us but those with young children, or who find these sort of things offensive was that directly opposite our room on the other side of the street was a sex cinema, the trail of men coming and going may make some people feel uneasy, however you are perfectly ok inside the hotel. The following morning, we went down for breakfast. The breakfast room really is not sufficient for the number of guests. Once we had found a table, we had almost had a stand up row with a woman who thought she should have the table, despite arriving after us. There was hardly any food, once we had mentioned this to a member of staff, all we got brought out was a bread roll (not what you would expect). We complained to the reception (the same guy from the previous day), and we got the usual Italian indifference. We then decided we would not bother with breakfast in the hotel for the remainder of our stay. The area around the hotel is ok, easy to reach the main attractions, and there are pleanty of little bars and restarants around without having to go too far, also as it is away from the main tourist area, these places are a bit cheaper. However do be careful when walking around the Termainal railway station at night, as there are a lot of down and outs. Apart from that a great weekend in a beautiful city was had

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen l
Reviews.Content: Recently we had the opportunity to stay 3 days at this property and were really pleased. The staff is extremely friendly, very helpful and most spoke good English. The location is within a mile to the main train station and the street noise is minimal. Best thing…jetted tubs, which is worth it’s weight in gold after you have walked all over Rome. The pictures on the internet really look like the hotel which is refreshing. Beds were extremely comfortable and the breakfast in the morning was complete. Would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Edward L
Reviews.Content: It's within walking distance from Termini the main train station, but when you have large luggages to carry, you may want to find somewhere else. The included breakfast was good. We stayed there for only one night before coming home and had to catch an early train in the morning, so did not spend a lot of time in the breakfast room. However, it was good. Lots of choices of tasty baked goods, and some hot stuff e.g. scambled egg. The receptionist was friendly but did not offer any extra help. Although we did not need any recommendation, but he didn't even bother asking. The free Wi-Fi requires a code, which you have to ask the reception for. Each equipment - computer, iphone, etc. - needs a separate code.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen S
Reviews.Content: An elegant, decent, clean and modern hotel with embassies nearby. Bus station quite far to walk day by day as Rome has many historical sites to visit. Castro Pretorio metro (Line B) is closer than to the Termini train station/metro about 10 min walk, but from Castro Pretorio you have to change the metro line to get to the most important historical sites in Rome. The wi-fi connection in the room not very good. I got disconnected many times and takes time to re-connect. Most of the staff is very nice and helpful except one who seems he works every day, long hours. He was at the front desk when we arrived and instead of" Welcome" he mention first: "I don't understand why people are comming for check-in when I have dinner!" :) I didn't take as an offence! It's a truly italian style to speak exactly what you have in your mind! :) Overall, a good experience and I would recommend to my friends as a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: oldpapi_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 10 min walk from Termini Station and is situated on a quiet, pleasant street with a number of embassies nearby. I stayed there with a group of 6 friends and we all found the place comfortable and convenient. The rooms varied in size from a very spacious double room on the first floor to some very small but still perfectly adequate single rooms on the fourth. The breakfast is generous and there is a good choice and there is free wi-fi and internet access in the hotel. Some of the staff members were pleasant and helpful but not all and I was not impressed by the response of the man I assume to be the manager when other guests in the hotel reported that they had been pickpocketed in the metro. He was at all helpful and basically didn't want to know about it.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Valorie O
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Art Deco very centrally located to the train station, the underground and sites of interest. We could easily walk or take public transit to the Coliseum, the Forum and other central sites. Nice, clean rooms with helpful staff. A continental breakfast which provided a variety of items was included. We were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing expectacular”
Reviews.Author: AnaLaCubana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 8 days, compered with hotels in the USA, this is a 3 stars hotel, not 4 stars. It's nothing expectacular and one the staff (Gianlucas) wasn't friendly at all. The breakfast was much better than in USA, and the location was very secure because there were 2 mayor embassy close by (Turkey and Russia) if we comeback to to Rome that the only reason we stay in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very surprised at large room!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo C
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and must say that I was impressed at the size of our room. The value for what we were offered was great! As this was our first stop of our European vacation, it was really nice to see that the hotel we booked was better than anticipated based on some of the reviews. There were three of us traveling and there was plenty of room for all of us. The bathroom was large and the decor throughout was very nice. We arrived early in the morning, so the room was not ready yet. The hotel let us check in our bags and we were off to see what Rome had to offer. When we returned, the room was ready for our much needed rest. The front desk was very polite and helpful. Internet was included in our room, so this was an even bigger plus! The metro and Termini were within a 10 minute walk each. Overall, I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, everything else pretty average”
Reviews.Content: The best things abut the hotel are the staff, who were friendly and efficient, and the convenient location. The rooms are fairly small but clean. Not much in the way of extras, although it seems you could ask for most things and they would be provided. My room was road facing and very noisy with the traffic outside, even though it appeared to be a quiet-ish road. Breakfast wasn't especially appetising, but does come with the room rate. If you're not expecting to spend much time at the hotel, other than sleeping, it's not a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is 'Underrated' on TripAdvisor -- Good Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DrewFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the ArtDeco in Rome September 2011, and came away pleasantly surprised. Hotel was boutique but had a modern feel to it, which was refreshing. It is located in near proximity to the Termini, probably about a 7-10 minute walk even with luggage, and most of the streets you are walking on are quieter than your average Roman street so getting their from the train station is fairly simple. The desk staff were helpful and friendly, spoke English well and even joked around with us when we checked in. The room was not humongous, but not having any other Roman hotels to compare it to I would say it was certainly adequate. Even though we had gotten the 'standard double', it came with a large enough bed which was actually quite comfortable, a small fridge, t.v. safe and desk. In fairness, this was the smallest bathroom we had during our two week stay, but hey -- it's a bathroom. On the topic of bathrooms, the only complaint I would really make about the hotel (and it is of a semi-personal nature) was that the toilet pressure in our room on the 4th floor was sufficient to flush about one piece of toilet paper at a time... so any interaction with the toilet tended to take about 4-5 times longer than an average bathroom pitstop! Breakfast was standard, neither superb nor terrible... as long as you like pastries, yogurt and fruit you will find everything you are looking for there! The neighbourhood, despite being near the train station, feels very safe at night, quiet but enchanting... while walking home a few nights after dinner, my wife and I felt like we had rented out the streets to ourselves because they were so quiet, it was very charming. All in all, I would for sure stay at the ArtDeco again should I ever get back to Rome -- it had everything we were looking for in a hotel and made our stay in Rome a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CarsonMarielle
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, clean hotel. Close to many restaurants, train station, stores etc. Staff were very helpful whenever we needed assistance, which was often. Thanks again we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerolyn C
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Hotel Art Deco! The entire staff made us feel right at home. We arrived at the hotel after a very long 24 hours of travel, our room was not scheduled to be available for another 3 hours. The front desk kindly took our bags, showed us to the dining room to partake in breakfast, gave us a map of the city, then helped us get set up with internet service. We sat in the cafe to pass some time. We waited maybe an hour, hour and half at most and they had our room ready for us. They even had taken all of our bags to the room already. The room we had was very spacious, with a king-sized bed. There was ample storage in the armoire, and a comfortable little sitting area. I had read in other reviews that the wifi probally wouldn't work in our room, but we had no problems at all. I also loved the decor through out the hotel, and our room was no exception. We very much enjoyed breakfast each morning. We had been told by friends that European breakfasts are rolls and coffee. So that is what we expected. Boy were we suprised when we found eggs, Italian bacon, rolls, cereal, cakes, an amazing cheese tort, yogurt, juices, fresh fruits, and yes of course coffee. I don't think we could have found a better breakfast. The dining room staff were very polite, and quick to bring us coffee. It was quite a let down to come home and have to make our own breakfasts. On days we left the very early to go on day trips, we were still able to have a wonderful breakfast. We thought our best hope was maybe we could maybe get a cup of coffee to go. Not at Art Deco! They prepared boxed breakfasts for us. This was something we never expected, and something we will never forget! Thank you Jose and kitchen staff! The front desk staff were always very professional, and helpful. They were happy to answer any questions we had about making our way around the city. They even assisted when I fell and sprained my ankle. They provided an ice pack, and even helped my husband find a pharmacy where the staff spoke English. I have to say that this hotel made our visit to Rome something to remember, we can't wait to begin planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “at home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bambi1977
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! Stylish, friendly and accommodating! Everyone at the front desk was more than willing to help us with directions and advice and even joked around with us, we had no issues and they always knew how to get from one place to another, even where i could get my gluten free food! Breakfast was amazing- desserts, eggs, ham, bacon, yogurt, juice, cereal, granola, a real feast for the eyes and stomach! The wait staff were very friendly and we had a lot of fun trying to see what sweet version of their cappuccino we could come up with :-) The room was technically small but with a tall ceiling to give it that old world look. The bed was hard but i found it no problems after my enormous days of walking- so no worries, pillows great! Cleaning people very thorough, bathroom awkward but i liked it- culturally interesting and clean. Loved having a bath and took advantage of it twice a day to rest my weary legs! Elevator is not for tall or 'large' people but stairs are soft underfoot, elevator was also fun to try just for the sake of it. Didnt hear much from the outside and loved being able to open the windows to look outside at the quaint cobblestone streets. Wake up call on time and air con worked fine. Safe also worked well. Not far from the main termini but when sightseeing you should use the closer station- castro pretoria. Quiet location, near turkish embassy. I would totally recommend this hotel. We plan to make it our home base on our now yearly visit to beautiful fascinating Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Brit-Born-Cyp
Reviews.Content: Had a very comfortable 4 night stay here in a double room on the 4th floor. Room was directly opposite the lift, but didn't experience any noise problems. Breakfast was typical for Rome hotels, basic but more than adequate. Staff at breakfast seemed more interested in re-laying the room for lunch even though there were still people coming down for breakfast, but happy to get hot beverages whenever we asked. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again when back in Rome. There are also some good local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “good location and safe across the Turkish Embassy”
Reviews.Author: catsandrats
Reviews.Content: The first thing about this hotel is that it is definetly safe: it is across the Turkish Embassy, so there are 2 guards present 24 hours a day, and the hotel receptionist is the only person who can open the hotel door, so strangers cannot enter The second thing that should be pointed out is that it is 10 min walking distance to Termini Station and about 3 minutes to Line B (blue) Castro Pretoria. This is important because Metro A is closed after 9pm until 2012 except on Satudays. So, if you are thinking of going out at night and using the night buses, this would be a good location to stay. The rooms are small, but the ceilings are high (around 4m), and the rooms are cleaned daily. The breakfast is acceptable, ham-cheese-eggs-jam-fruit-plum cake-juice-tea or coffee, but no olives, tomatoes etc. There is also a computer and printer for internet access beside the reception, which can be used for 5 minutes (internet and print outs is free of charge). One more point, they ask for the city tax (3 Euros per person per night) at departure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our 2nd honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: FEnriqueCV
Reviews.Content: Lot of hotels in the area but this hotel catched up my attention as its location. 5 minutes walking to Termini train and bus station which seemed to be the major one in Rome. Close to all sightseeings. Our room was fantastic, huge, and spotless, if I sincere I expected an old hotel but this was a nice surprise. Front desk guys very friendly and always helpful. We wil definitively come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Quietcreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in their triple room and we really like it. The room is adequate in size for 3 single beds. Nice,friendly and helpful staff like Gianluca at the frontdesk. Good, decent hotel in a quiet, peaceful location. It's 10-15 minute walk to Termini and nearest Metro Station. And for 1 euro takes you to the major tourist destinations, including the Vatican. Located near the Russian and Turkish foreign offices so guards are always around the corner. Aside from restaurants that serve Italian food, there are also a few kebabs eateries nearby, including one or two that cater the Filipino communities and tourists. After a day walking we come back knowing the jacuzzi tub is waiting to sooth our tired feet. The free breakfast buffet is superb. They serve hot and cold cuts and the coffee is great. True value for money. Why bother looking for B&B or hostel if you can get the real deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel bit of a walk to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good experience at this hotel. Rooms were small but well appointed and the tall ceilings made it feel more spacious than it was. The breakfast was very good and while it was a bit of a walk to the Metro, it certainly wasn't too arduous esp compared to the total miles logged on the pedometer during our trip. I have also stayed at the BW Villafranca and Sheraton Roma and would rank this as number 2 behind the Villafranca (for me its proximity to the metro station outweighs the slightly nicer and more modern rooms at Art Deco) but i would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanderawx
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with nice and helpful staff, great breakfast, convenient location, knowledge of the area, room is small but you are in a historic building.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and the Artdeco Rome. We found a fantastic rate on their website EUR119.00 for a triple room in July which was fantastic. At first we wanted to stay somewhere close to the Spanish Steps but went to this hotel because of the great rate. In the end we were very happy with this location close to Termini. The hotel is tucked away from all of the crazy summer Rome crouds yet close enough to take advantage of all the sights. We walked or caught the subway to all of the sites and felt very safe in this area. The room was large for a triple and left us with plenty of storage space. The bathroom was huge and the air conditioning worked well. Although Art Deco is not my favourite style the rooms and public areas are quite stylish. The breakfast was good and the staff accomodating. The day we left they provided us with a late check-out even though they were fully booked. For the price this hotel cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would use again”
Reviews.Author: Betty99_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Clean hotel and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: VajVaj
Reviews.Content: had a nice stay at the hotel, ok price for being in Rome. no real real remark, more than I can´t agree with the 4 star rating. I would say its more a 3 star hotel. Breakfast was included but not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, Amazingly Helpful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: themizzvee
Reviews.Content: Wasn't the easiest Hotel to find, but when we found it we were pleasantly surprised. Great location, ideal for the metro, one stop from the main trainstation and one stop from the colluseum. When we got there we realised my partner had lost his wallet. The staff were very helpful, offered us a phone to cancel the card with and were generally very sweet about the whole thing. Small but perfectly sized room (although my one gripe would be that the bed was like sleeping on concrete), ideal for a city break. Breakfasts were well worth getting up early for. Can't beat a continental breakfast! We are looking to go back again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: RoslynMontreal
Reviews.Content: -We stayed at this hotel for 4 nigths. We had a triple room on the 4th floor. The room was very clean and surprisingly spacious enough to accomodate the 3 of us and our luggages. We slept very well as we were on a higher floor. The windows are not soundproof at all, so the sound of the relatively busy main street could be certainly incommodating for ligth sleepers... The air conditionning worked perfectly and stayed on during the day. The only problem with the room was the low water pressure in the shower. It was difficult to even wash our hair and not refreshing at all after walking a whole day in the heat. -The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. They provided good advices. -The free computer / printer is very useful especially to make reservations for the touristics sites. -The breakfast was decent, but quite basic compare to what we enjoyed during the rest of our trip. The juice was not from fresh fruits so was pretty bad. But the worst was the staff attitude. You had to order your coffee with them but they would make everything possible to avoid eye contact. They looked very bored and unhappy. -The hotel location is good as it is easy to get to the subway (5 minutes). However, I would have preferred to be closer (walking distance) to a better selection of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A good overall experience with lots to recommend - would use again.”
Reviews.Author: PGTIPS65
Reviews.Content: Good location not far from Roma Termini - approx 5 mins walk. Quiet area near several embassies so also felt safe. Room was very clean (maid service daily) and a good size. Room facilities were all good (especially the air con) apart from the shower which was very low pressure so it didn't really help after long hot days out sightseeing. Liked the little art deco touches, such as the old fashioned telephone & radio on the bedside cabinets. The bed itself had a mattress which was on the harder side but we slept well enough. Breakfast was quite varied & provided decent quality / quantity. Staff were all pleasant & friendly enough & they provided help / assistance when required. Free internet & able to use a printer as well. A good overall experience with lots to recommend - would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelchick
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the size of room in this hotel. We spent two nights pre-cruise in this hotel. It is close to the Termini train station that we took from the airport. Do yourselves a favor though. Take a cab to the hotel. Dragging luggage thru the streets of Rome is NOT a fun thing to do! The hotel was nice and clean and the breakfast was good and plentiful. The elevator was quite small and the one to the 5th floor was even smaller. But luckily we didn't have to go up and down very often. I would not recommend this for wheelchairs. The elevator to the 5th floor (first one only went to the 4th floor), was so small that I could barely fit with my luggage. The water pressure was not good, but not uncommon in Europe. Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: ““Excellent service and comfortable room, we would stay here again.””
Reviews.Author: jen4000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel the morning of our stay (for 4 nights) because we left another hotel after not being happy with its condition (it was a 1 star). The jump from a 1 star to this 4 star was a huge improvement. Since we booked at the last minute (literally) the first 2 nights were discounted. The bed is a true king size and is extremely comfortable, memory foam. The bathroom was large and was very clean. Our room was very quiet and relaxing. The front desk staff was very helpful, assisting us with directions... The best part of this hotel was the breakfast! It was wonderful including: eggs, ham, croissants, all different types of pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt, and their cappuccino was the best I had while in Europe. The breakfast was really great and made the cost of the room well worth it and was served as early as 7am and as late as 10:30 I believe. The only thing I did not like was that since we checked in extremely early, our room was not ready. We left our bags by the desk and the staff said they would take care of them. That night we found our bags had been sitting on a dolly in the hall all day, unattended. I would make sure they lock up your luggage before you leave for the day. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it. It is only 10 min walk from Termini station, which can then access all of the major sites in the city either by bus or metro. Also, only 5 min walk to a nearby grocery store. Wireless internet also worked very well, making it possible to skype, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: JoMarieS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Mid-June and really had a nice stay. I was worried after reading some of the other reviews. We arrived after our 9 hour flight around 9:30 am and already knew our room wouldn't be ready. They allowed us to leave our bags and gave us a map of the area. We headed out and quickly found that the hotel is not centrally located. It was quite a walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. We didn't even attempt to walk to the Vatican and opted for the subway instead. It wasn't a huge deal, and since it was our first time in Rome, Italy for that matter, we didn't mind. If you're looking for a hotel that IS centrally located, you probably need to look elsewhere. My main concern, after reading the reviews, was the size of the room and the bathroom. Both were great. The furniture was a tad on the low side, but other than that it was a nice sized room...it was a double on the 2nd floor. We looked out over the front street and being as exhausted as we were, the commotion nightly from the main street didn't phase us. It wasn't bad at all. The bed was hard, which isn't like our bed at home, but again, being as exhausted as we were, it was fine. The bathroom was spacious and clean, clean, clean. Reception was always available to help us, make a dinner reservation, or call a taxi. There was a computer in the front reception area which I used to check email. We didn't bring a laptop so don't know about the internet in the room. The breakfast was nice, too. Don't get there too late though or you'll miss the good stuff. We arrived early two of the mornings we were there and had great eggs, croissants, and cappucino, but one day we got there closer to closing time and the eggs were cold and everything else was almost gone. The fresh fruit juice was delicious, too. All in all, we really had a nice stay here. The restaurants around/near the hotel were all great and we loved finding different places on different streets. The hotels recommendation of Caruso's for gelato was delicious. Thanks Art Deco for a great first three nights in Italia!

Reviews.Title: “not very central, but great beds!”
Reviews.Author: Kian19
Reviews.Content: The single rooms are quiet smal and the service is ok. It seems as if only men work at this hotels reception.... at the bathroom they had some kind of a spray for womens private areas,..hm. But I slept really good at this hotel and I loved the view from the forth floor. They can not garantee that you get non smoking room. But my smoking room did not smell. The breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel changed booking without informing us”
Reviews.Author: CherJoy
Reviews.Content: After reading online reviews this booking was made with Hotel Camelia via Venere.com. When we arrived at the Hotel we were told that the booking was actually with their sister hotel Best Western ArtDeco which was another block away. As were walking with our luggage we were not happy. The Hotel ArtDeco was a bit tired and rundown. Our room was small and the bathroom had no water pressure which meant just a trickle of water from the basin, slightly more from the shower which made a shower difficult, washing hair would have been impossible. Staff took note of the problem but were not too concerned. When checking out staff confused our account with another room. Bar staff served a drink then disappeared, hard to find when we wanted to pay.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, will be back”
Reviews.Author: Sutendra
Reviews.Content: This was a change made by us from another hotel in the vicinity. The hotel was very well located, very clean interiors, friendly staff and good ambiance. The walking convenience to all the major areas and tourist buses made it specially interesting We liked the overall experience and its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MustaPekka
Reviews.Content: Checkin was fast and friendly. Was given room even though I arrived a few hours before checkin time. Had ordered a SGL room but was given a double. Room was in good condition but farily small. Location of the hotel is very good as it is walking distance to main train station and a few of the main sights. WIFI was available but not free. Breakfast was ok with fairly good selection. However, scrambled eggs were not the best as they had been fried far too long making it very dry.... Still this is a good hotel especially since location is very good and having good price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “An 'ok' hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpmcba
Reviews.Content: Hotel is closer to the Castro Pretorio metro (Line B) than to the Termini train station/metro which takes several more blocks to walk. Located in a quiet neighborhood, and safe walking even at night. Many area restaurants, but we did not see any groceries near the hotel. Room was small for two people, but clean. Bathroom was standard size and clean. Internet access in the room worked fine. Daily full american breakfast buffet (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage) was alright but the breads were too hard and the breakfast pastries didn't look or taste fresh. Restaurant staff were courteous and attentive. Inspite of the hotel's art deco theme, I think the place is in need of renovation; and, I think deserves only a Three Star rating, at most.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable and clean hotel but reception staff should learn to smile!”
Reviews.Author: delilah21
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in almost every respect. The Art Deco Style is wonderful and our room was very good indeed with an extremely comfortable bed. There was a wide choice of food at the breakfast buffet and the waiting staff were attentive and helpful. One small observation is that we found the reception staff somewhat indifferent. They really need to smile more and try to appear interested in the guests - it does help!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: USAFNCO
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. The location was fantastic close to the Termini station and many restaurants and sites. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi and a delicious complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Art Deco Style”
Reviews.Author: LavenderHills
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good option for the area, which is a lively area to stay in surrounded by embassies. It is close to Termini, between 5 & 7 minutes walk. Get a Roma pass if sightseeing and utilise the metro. We chose this hotel for our Rome stay as we are tired of corporate 4 stars, and this hotel is authentically art deco. We got a good deal for our room, which was a superior suite. It was wonderful to have the balcony, even in February. The rooms in the suite were lovely & warm. I loved the novelty of the lift! Breakfast is more than adequate to start your day with a good selection to suit most palates. The front of house crews at reception and on breakfast duty were pleasant. The room service was great, providing tea/coffee tray to the room. Special mention for the turn down service which was exceptional. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights mid February and was very pleased with our choice. We arrived late at night (1 am) but had notified the hotel in advance and had received comfirmation that there would be no problems checking in. All went smoothly. We had a double room which was clean and comfortable with ample storage space. The bathroom was spacious and clean too. On arrival the room felt very hot so we adjusted the controls and fell into bed. We woke up in what felt like a sauna. After the 2nd day we realised that adjusting the dial didn't have any effect. We requested another room and this was organised almost immediately, which we were very pleased about. Breakfast was fine, continental style, (probably nuch better than average in Rome from the other reviews we have read). The coffee was great which we don't often find in hotels outside of Scandinavia. The location was convenient and felt very safe even in the evenings. We were close to both the main train station and both metro lines, very easy to get about. Hit most of the main attractions in 15-20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Feel-good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I tend to approach all hotels with misgivings, but the Artdeco turned out to be a very good choice. The area is pleasant, situated close to villas/embassies with gardens, so there are plenty of trees, and I could hear parrots when I had the window open. It's about a ten minute walk from Termini, and close to some useful downtown bus routes. There's a good supermarket a couple of blocks away. Reception was helpful and friendly on arrival, and that continued throughout the stay. I'd say the breakfast staff tended more towards efficiency than friendliness, but all the staff were polite and well-trained. My single room was an adequate size. The floor plan showed larger rooms which would be ideal for couples/families. It was clean and bright, and had all the advertised facilities - the good-sized fridge and safe were tucked in an alcove which I didn't see at first. A small but adequate TV had channels in a number of languages. The bed was very comfortable, and everything in the bathroom worked well. The free wifi (you get an access code from reception) worked fine. Lighting and heating was good, and so was sound insulation: the walls were padded under the wallpaper (why don't all hotels do this!!!!), which is probably why I heard nothing from neighbours, and the windows shut out the street sound, which could be noisy if there were sirens or horns beeping. I slept well. Breakfast was an excellent and attractive cold buffet. There were also bacon and eggs, but they looked less appealing, bearing in mind I'm not an egg-eater anyway. Downsides? The wifi needed to be reconnected every hour, but that may have been me, and wasn't a major problem. I had to ask for coffee/tea at breakfast because they kept skipping my table - I think they thought I was waiting for someone. These are just minor grievances. I enjoyed my stay very much, and was pleased I'd chosen to stay here. A friend was staying at a more expensive hotel nearby, and although he may have had more facilities, I felt the staff were better at the Artdeco, and my room was equally as good, so it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but don't believe the photos showing a large Superior double Room.”
Reviews.Author: LimerickLady13
Reviews.Content: We had booked a superior double room as we thought the photos showing this type were great, as well as also having a jacuzzi bath. The room we received was small (with jacuzzi) but nothing like the photos, and after having checked with reception, was told this was also a 'superior' room! Very misleading photos and disappointing. Many stains on the bedroom carpet. Breakfast was poor and cold. Nevertheless, staff were helpful in assisting with a postal delivery for us, received before our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “little quite gem”
Reviews.Author: csant
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nts and must admit was v impressed, rooms and bathroom although on the small side were v clean; above all loved the deco in the public areas, the efficient staff on duty namely reception and breakfast crew, plus the fact that although v central a good nt sleep was ensued thanks to its quiet location...will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomaddeb
Reviews.Content: i stayed in December for 4 nights with my teenager daughter. The hotel was close to Termini as we arrived by train. The rooms are quite large for European standards, very clean as well. Breakfast choice was excellent. Staff helpful and attentive if needing directions. Free wifi which comes in handy with a teenager. Would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, room, price and staff”
Reviews.Author: ACMMM
Reviews.Content: I spent one Saturday and night at this hotel after my friend and I did fairly extensive research, as good as someone who have never been in Rome can be. We were pleasantly surprised by the tastefully decorated room, convenient location (minutes walk to central train station, and helpful staff (in all shifts). We had a great time in Rome for the two days, and this hotel was a part of it. The hotel staff even recommended an outstanding (food and price) restaurant around the corner, even though they run a restaurant themselves. I have to give credit when it is due. WiFi is also free. Breakfast is excellent. All for the bestwestern.com published price. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: injerusalem
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for a few days on the way to the USA (from Israel.) I had a delightful stay at The Best Western Hotel Artdeco. It was clean and quiet. The entire staff were great and helped me out a few times (directions, recommendations, etc.) The area was safe with armed guards nearby (in front of embassies, I think.) The 10 minute walk from the main train station, Termini, was easy to do even with luggage and makes it easy to get everywhere you need to in this great city. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “bad location, friendly staff.. bad room, smelly”
Reviews.Author: angelowknd
Reviews.Content: Well I wasn't expecting to be in a posh area or a posh hotel. yet I was happy to meet friendly staff at my check in. that later also helped me to fine my way in to the job I was going to.. the location isn't that nice but it's safe and have a metro near by.... also termini station (main train station in Rome) is very close. only that the taxi driver asked me to pay him 25 euros to get me to my hotel -from termini- when he should have asked for 7-10 (but that's the italian taxi drivers) the inside of the hotel was nice, breakfast was simple but had everything you need. (eggs, fresh bread, selection of ham and salami etc..) on the bad sides add the tinyyyy room I was staying in.. and the tv chanels that were only Italian with no international Chanels overall, I would recommencement this hotel but only if you need to be on that area of Rome. and you don't want to spend too much. Rome have fantastic hotels closer to the nicest areas of the city and generally will not cost you too much.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoStephaniew
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on points for our first night in Rome. We weren't sure what to expect since it was fairly close to the Termini Station, which we try to avoid. However, we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, secure and art deco certainly describes the decor. The staff was pleasant and attentive. In 20 minutes (with a seven year old in tow) we were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain. Wifi is free and it works very well (Skype is blocked). The breakfast is plentiful, but not very good. Stay away from the eggs. it's too bad they didn't just do a good Italian breakfast rather than trying to do a british breakfast that just doesn't work. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location, but chic hotel at a great value!”
Reviews.Author: kbs_chicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel really isn't a good location for exploring Rome by foot, one would pay quite a bit for taxis to the center, BUT it is a great value for cute, trendy rooms that are cheerful and clean. And the staff was great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget who doesn't mind being outside the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the perfect break”
Reviews.Author: hotels71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 day midweek break in Rome and stayed 3 nights here. Service was superb, recepionists couldnt be more helpful. Free web access. Buffet style breakfast was very good. Only about 4 mins from Metro station. Forget other reviewers comments about sex shops, seedy area etc etc..... there are very definitely much worse areas (I know we saw them from the safety of a taxi) The hotel does benefit from being visibly secure as the Turkish and Russian embassies are on the next block and have Italian armed guards as street security. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: rodriginho
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, nice staff (I had suffered from a shock when arriving in Rome, with the woman selling the tickets for the train from airport to city trying to talk me into taking the more expensive bus, and being extremly rude! - the receptionist on the other hand was helpful, and had good English). Location seems very convenient, close to the train station, although there might be some places in the vicinity where I wouldn't recommend walking by yourself at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CAGirl411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice part of Rome near the embassy. It's located on a side street, so not too noisy at night. The metro station is very close by. You would never know it's a part of a hotel chain because of the unique art deco style, tastefully decorated. The separate sleeping area had hard wood floors and a colorful, sliding pocket door. The bathroom was very clean and had a bath with hot tub jets! Unfortunately, the carpet in the "living" area looked dirty and could have used a good cleaning. The mini bar was not restocked every day and there was no coffee or tea maker. However, the price of the room included a breakfast. The staff at the hotel were professional and they spoke English among other languages. There was a little computer station in the hotel lobby where guests could surf the internet and use the printer for free. This comes in handy in Rome, where internet access is quite spotty. The value is incredible.. For what you are paying, you really get a nice hotel experience. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete value for money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: weetbix75
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend the Art Deco highly enough. The hotel is located within 10 minutes of the Rome main train station and is clean, excellently decorated and has great staff, all at a very affordable price. We arrived early and our room was not ready. The reception desk stored our bags and let us freshen up before heading out until our room was ready. On returning to the hotel later in the day, our bags were in our room and the air conditioning had been turned on full to allow for the searing heat on that day. The room itself was spacious, beautifully decorated, bright and airy with a great size bathroom to match. Being on the non-touristy side of Rome, the location is quiet which meant we got a great night's sleep (though I wouldn't suggest walking alone on the streets at night). Breakfast was included in the price but wasn't the best, but this would be the only minor glitch we could find with the hotel. The Art Deco also has an agreement in place with a local private transfer service providing transport to the airport for a total of 48 Euro - making it comparable with catching the train to the airport for 2 people. Overall, I could not recommend this hotel high enough for people looking for affordable comfort in Rome at the 4 star level. (Yes, the lift is miniature but it has character and given the age of the building, you have to allow for the fact that the building was never designed to house an elevator!)

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: NatLDN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights . The hotel was a real treat, and luxurious compared to my normal 3 Star experiences. I was worried about staying in a big chain (Best Western) as i wanted a boutique experience, but i needed have worried. The room we stayed in was large with a lovely 4 poster bed, and ensuite with Jacuzzi bath – great after a long day sightseeing. I think each room is decorated differently, ours was all retro-art-deco blue. The hotel is in a quiet area with a few restaurants nearby, but only a short walk from a metro stop from which you can get all over the city, it’s also a nice area to go for a stroll in after dinner. The breakfast was good too. We never ate in the hotel for dinner as there are so many great restaurants to try.

Reviews.Title: “Not of American Best Western Standard”
Reviews.Author: rykylex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a seedy part of Rome with a strip joint 100 ft away with a triple x theater. The hotel is very old, the rooms are very small, and service was non existent. Their bathrooms smelled like urine and their air conditioning system barely worked. Their elevator or "lift" is the size of a shoe closet and can barely fit 3 petite women (without luggage). The claim they are a 4 star hotel. I don't know by who's standards but definitely not my ideal 4 star hotel in America...not even close. I would compare this to a Super 6 roach motel. The only reason why we ended up here was because our original hotel overbooked and couldn't accommodate us. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who actually has a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MJLAlberta_Canada
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We were here for 2 nights and would stay again. the bed was very comfortable and the room was a good size. It had 2 windows, neither had a fantastic view, but the fresh air was nice. All staff were helpful and spoke English very well. The breakfast was good, especially the fruit, yogurt and coffees. We walked down Via palestro one night for dinner at Mamma Angela's. The best shrimp rissotto I have had in my life. Great house wine too. The hotel is nice and quiet, away from the action. Some of the taxi drivers did not know the address, so be sure to write it down before you head there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and recommend”
Reviews.Author: J_Baye
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 5 nights with my wife. We had originally booked the 3* Hotel Camelia, but on arrival were told they had overbooked and were being moved to their sister hotel the 4* Artdeco which was just around the corner. It's closeness to Termini make it in my opinion very convenient. Firstly it's direct link to the airport, and secondly it's where the two Rome metro lines cross. I can however, understand some people feeling that this area isn't centrally located enough. My wife and I though are happy to walk around cities, rarely using public transport so we didn't think this a problem. The hotel was nice, room was clean and breakfast more than ample. On arrival the receptionist; I think it was Giai, was very friendly. One minor complaint. The guest directory in the room says that you can have tea/coffee at any time by calling reception. We arrived back one evening at 11.15pm, and asked the receptionist if we could have coffee, to be told with a shrug that it was not possible. The area has plenty of cafes/restaurants. On the first evening we visited one 10 minutes walk away the other side of Termini called Old Marconi. Busy with locals, friendly atmosphere and very reasonably priced for both food and drinks, so we kept going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CynzLondon
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on reviews on TA and it was a very good choice indeed. Staff were very friendly and hotel rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “a good place”
Reviews.Author: al_gupta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is abt 15mins walk from Termini, but not in the city centre - we had to walk quite some time back in the evenings, and since the metro network isn't very spread out, my wife did get quite tired! The price was accordingly good. Also, we reached late evening and had a morning train 3 days later - closeness to Termini was very important. The room was small but had a working jacuzzi in the bath. The room was on the top floor and east facing - we got some very good morning views. Though it meant there was no direct lift from the ground floor. One either change on 4th floor or take the lift from 1st floor. We reached on 25thDec - the restaurant was closed for 2-3 days. Only breakfast was served. There are a couple of nice eateries on the way to the hotel, hence it wasn't really a problem. We didnt have any problems there, neither with the rooms nor with the staff. 2 of the 3 front desk personnel we met were very courteous. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the ratings were high (despite reading a few dodgy reviews). The room we were given was a superior room (apparently) but was dismal! The bathroom smelt of urine, the Jacuzzi bath didn't work, the shower didn't work properly, the TV didn't have any English channels (and they couldn't figure out how to get them). When we arrived on Boxing Day evening (very tired and with a baby), we found out that their restaurant was closed for 2 days and they were not operating room service either for the same days. Not what one would expect from a 4 star hotel!!! We only stayed 1 night out of 6 (one night too many!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good restaurants and bars nearby”
Reviews.Author: LadyLambrini
Reviews.Content: Really close to the Termini it is very easy to get to, we found the hotel pretty good really. The rooms are a little small - but how much time do you spend in your room in Rome? Our only complaint was that the room was really hot, even with the aircon on - we actually slept with the windows wide open (& it was December). There are some really good restaurants & bars nearby within very easy walking distance & although a bit of a trek you can walk to nearly all of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “BW Miss-Represents this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaci99
Reviews.Content: It is located on 'the other side" of Rome . . . not really the side where you want to stay. After return home we heard it was in a bad area of Rome. It is walking distance from the train station and the metro which is a plus. We felt safe to walk to and from the hotel to the train and metro. The staff was friendly before our arrival and accommodated a change to our reservation before our arrival. The room was small but all rooms in Europe are small so just expect that. I was not pleased to return from a day of sight see in 70 degree weather to a warm and stuff room with NO A/C!!! The hotel website does advertise A/C but the hotel turns off the A/C in the winter. WT. . . ??? I have contacted BW corporate about this mss-representation and they seem to concur that this is the situation but will not address the fact that it IS advertised on the hotel website that they have A/C. The hotel offered no solution to seasonal A/C. They seemed to just blow it off like whatever, what can you do about it. We ASKED for a fan, they did accommodate that request. Which was the only way we able to stay. It was warm spell during our November 2009 vacation. The breakfast included with the stay was very interesting, they served what appeared to be raw bacon. My suggestion: map this hotel using Google maps then look for a hotel on the opposite side of the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: sphouch
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Rome and Pompeii, during which time we stayed at this hotel. I would say it was a good hotel. The rooms are sized to fit you and your bags, and not much else, but we were comfortable. While we didn't eat more than one breakfast at the hotel, we did get there early and found a nice spread of breakfast foods available. My wife did enjoy her coffee there. Generally speaking we had very few problems, though I found the hotel staff to be somewhat gruff, to the point of seeming annoyed at entertaining questions/requests (not all the staff, but enough to warrant mention). The location is not bad, though from what I saw walking through Rome, if you're within the city walls, there doesn't really appear to be a bad location as the city is rather compact. It was nice to have the added sense of security of being sandwiched between two embassies within a couple blocks of each other. If I go back to Rome, I would definitely consider returning to this hotel, as it was a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want Hot Water/Internet”
Reviews.Author: gt7275a
Reviews.Content: Two separate stays for a total of 7 nights. The hotel was pretty good overall, decent room, clean bathroom, not too noisy, and the breakfast was excellent. HOWEVER....Unless you take a shower/bath between 7am and 8:30am or in the afternoon don't expect hot water. I think they turn off the water heater at night and when they do turn it on it isn't able to keep up with demand. I took showers at various times of the morning and in the evening (or tried to) and about 70% were cold or lukewarm. I mentioned it to the front desk with not much of a response. Since I don't see anyone else commenting on it I will just chalk it up to unlucky timing. Also, the internet would only connect for a few minutes during the ENTIRE STAY...crazy. Other guests had just as much trouble as me. They use a third party host and it was just a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxysCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, breakfast is stunning. Little bit far from metro, but still within walking distance. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly!”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Poor location - nothing nearby. Rooms and corridors had a toilet like smell. Had an under street level room gloomy and damp. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location ~ you can do MUCH better!”
Reviews.Author: yakadi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an 8-day Navigator of the Seas Royal Caribbean cruise planned out of Citavecchia, Italy so we thought we'd spend a night before in Rome and a night after the cruise in Rome (good idea, btw). We stayed both nights at this hotel. This was our first trip to Italy and we were being economical taking the train from the Termini to the port and back ~ which was fine. However, I would recommend you find a different hotel to stay-in. This hotel is a lot farther from the Termini than other reviews led me to believe. On top of that, it is at the very end of the neighborhood where most hotels are so you are walking a lot just to find one or two restaurant sor to enjoy any type of sightseeing and the area is not incredibly safe for nigh walking i.e. no late dinners out unless you take a taxi. And, if you have any luggage with you, it's just a big pain because the streets near this hotel are not made to pull rolled luggage on and I ended-up with a broken roller and ruined suitcase after walking to this hotel. Having said that, after we passed many other hotels we could have and should have booked, we finally found our hotel - many of these other hotels were hotels I had looked at on Expedia - which were less expensive - I would recommend the Venetia Palace as it is very, very close to the Termini and we walked past it many times wishing we had stayed there. So, we get to the hotel itself is not so great either - carpets are old and the staff didn't seem friendly pretty much ever. The elevators did not work while we were there - both times - and apparently, the elevator down or up to the 2nd floor NEVER works so you have to always carry your luggage up or down one big winding staircase, no matter what - not good for us since we overpacked for our cruise. Also, my husband smokes so we reserved a smoking room and upon check-in they said they had no record (Expedia has done this to us before so I wouldn't be surprised if that wasn't true). Regardless, we had to have a non-smoking room which made the hubby very unhappy. On the way back, we did get a smoking room. As for the room itself - it's more than adequate - very, very clean - nice bathrooms - both very important to me - I don't like "old" places and our room seemed very modern. TV worked fine - there was CNN so hubby was happy. The outlets are all European and I had forgot a converter so they said they would hold "one of them" for me upon return - when we returned the next desk clerk said "it is already out with someone" so apparently, they only had one converter ~ so, no flat iron or Internet usage for me both stays. Which reminds me, they advertise wireless Internet but because I was never able to get a converter to plug-in our laptop, I have no clue if they have it available in the rooms - there is a small desk by the front entry with a computer but there is a sign by it saying "you must register with the front desk to use, blah blah blah" Breakfast at the restaurant was the best thing the hotel did - a big display of hot foods, cold cereals, juices, coffee, danishes, fruits, to-go foods, etc. Very nice and all free. As for the location, past the walking with suitcases, I just wouldn't recommend it if you want to be in the middle of lots of restaurant choices and/or hustle and bustle. We took our time to see a lot more of Rome and felt like we stayed in the absolute wrong area. I would recommend someone stay near Vatican City or the famous shopping street in Rome - where there are lots of shopping and eating options - and pay the $6 or $7 taxi fee to take you to the Termini and back, if you must. Also, we ignorantly paid 48 Euros to have the front desk arrange us a taxi to the airport on the morning we left. They told us we would have a "private driver/not a taxi" and the guy shows-up in an old station wagon marked taxi, drove like a maniac, then the car literally died on the highway, but we finally made it in one piece and the guy told us 48 Euros was not enough. We gave him our last change. This was a ripoff arranged by the hotel. We would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco - more a good 3 star than a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller1953
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, in a quiet reasonably upmarket street lined with embassies, but walking distance to many sights and only 2 blocks to the metro. Our superior room was spacious by city centre standards, well appointed, clean and comfortable. The bathroom too was a reasonable size with spa bath. Pleasant public areas with mixed levels of service at breakfast depending on number of guests and number of serving staff; food offered at breakfast adequate but would not win any prizes. Most of the reception staff were very helpful. Further down the street were a number of pizzerias and restaurants, all very busy and offering good food at reasonable prices. Check out the '39' Pizzeria and Mamma Angela restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LoogaGuzzi
Reviews.Content: A smart, mid-range hotel in the middle of Rome. Good for access to/from Termini and the trains or buses. Just a five minutes walk from the station. Lots of restaurants in the surrounding streets if you do not want to travel too far. The rooms are quite big for Rome compared to other hotels I've used in the past. The bathroom was fine and everything was very clean and tidy. Extra soap or towels appeared before they were needed . Breakfast was quite a good selection of cold stuff and pastries. Plus a small amount of hot stuff if you were there early. Internet access was a bit poor - no wifi and just one connected pc in the lobby. I think it was a little expensive - 140 Euros but we were booked in by our company system which always seems to manage to pay top rates and it doesnt help that the exchange rate is so poor now, Overall though I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but could probably do better”
Reviews.Author: acoachcool
Reviews.Content: I found the Artdeco to be an adequate hotel, with the usual expectiations that a large chain would have. Private baths, TV, lounge/cafe, clean rooms. Breakfast was included in which makes having a meal before heading out a plus. The front desk personnel lacked personality which discourages travelers when help is needed. Our group was 5 couples and each couple had a different size room and accomodations. To see the differences between rooms made for interesting conversations. Ours had a shower stall that was the size of a phone booth. Their location being a few blocks away from Termini Station makes getting around Roma very pleasant. In a pinch I would stay here again, but I'm certain I can do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “I'd be surprised if you could get better in Rome for the price.”
Reviews.Author: bbinsheffield
Reviews.Content: Some friends and myself spent a week in the Art Deco in July 09. This is the type of hotel we usually try to go for - comfy and clean, but not overly posh being as we spend most of the time out. We were impressed with the hotel, as although it was part of a large chain (BestWestern), it felt small enough to have an atmosphere and not too impersonal. This is probably partly due to the hotel being independantly owned and managed. This also meant that one became familliar with the (very helpful, very pleasant) staff. Generally speaking, we though that it would be difficult to find such a clean, smart hotel in Rome for the price. The train station "Termini" is only approx 5 - 10 minutes walk from this hotel, so if you can cope with dragging your suitcases that far then that's probably the best idea. If, like us you've got a cigarette deprived, menopausal woman in the party, you'll end up getting a taxi, like we did. General Hint: If you must get a taxi, don't ask to be taken to the hotel, give the name of the road it is on. That way the taxi driver will think you've got a vague idea of where you're going and is less likely to rip you off! Like some other reviewers, we came to the conclusion that all the taxi drivers in Rome that we had used were thieving so-and-so's, and as a result ended up hiring a car. Though the hotel doesn't have it's own car park, at extra cost it can be arranged through reception to use another car park nearby. The only real negative with the hotel is that it doesn't have a terrace or any outdoor seating, so sitting out in the evening with a glass of wine (Italian Beer that we had wasn't that good!) is out of the question. Also, the hotel didn't have a swimming pool, but very few hotels in Rome city centre do unless you're prepared to pay big money. Overall a nice little hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Very close to main station, but be wary of taxi charges to the airport!!”
Reviews.Author: TheCunnos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights recently after staying a few nights just outside of the city. A very nice hotel, but not quite as large as the company website makes out. We arrived in the morning, and were very surprised to find our room was ready as it was before check-in time. This was a great start to our stay. The room was a good size with a large bed, and the bathroom was spacious too. We had read other comments about the area the hotel was in, we did not feel un-safe at all as each time we walked back to the hotel we met armed guards outside a couple of local embassies. The hotel is very close to the main station, and also a Metro station is 5-10 minute walk away. Breakfast is basic but adequate for a hotel of that size, and for what we were paying we cannot complain. We had to fly out from Ciampino airport and so were advised by the hotel reception to get a taxi. They said they had an agreed rate of 46 Euros with the taxi firm. However, when we got to the airport, the meter was showing no-where near this amount. We gave the taxi driver 50 Euros but he did not seem to want to give any change. We did feel a little ripped off by the taxi driver. (This also happened when we arrived in Rome and got a taxi to another hotel so be wary and do not just take the first price they offer you). We also found out from the people in the queue with us at the airport that you can get a much cheaper bus from the train station (Terravision). We will be doing that next time! Overall a nice hotel and we cannot complain with the facilities or service. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Rome exploring”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art Deco for four nights. It was a good choice, as it is located close to Termini station, but not close enough to have that 'near the train station' feel to it. The reception staff was generally pleasant, and the room we had was of a good size and was pretty modern, with satellite TV, an electronic safe, and a very good central air conditioning system. The bathroom was clean and new, and we were pleasantly surprised to find that our bath/shower unit was in fact a shower and a jacuzzi bath – but then we found out that the jacuzzi was inoperable, which was a pity. The lack of free wireless internet was also a pity, as many hotels are now offering this in Europe. However, the hotel did offer an internet station in the reception area which was free (and fast), and which also had free printing facilities (although the printer was pretty slow). Breakfast at the hotel was continental, but with some 'hot' items such as bacon and eggs as well. The hotel staff was happy to call airport taxis and to arrange for taxi pick-ups for us.

Reviews.Title: “4-star rating is too high. 3 Tops.”
Reviews.Author: tagavon2000
Reviews.Content: At 75 Euro per night online ($118), I can't really complain. But this hotel is not more than OK. There is never more than one person behind the desk, even at peak times, so if you need something it could be a wait. Staff is responsive and helpful but multi tasking is not their strong suit. Air conditioning (record heat, 101+ one day) was weak (top floor corner room) and conked out twice in six nights, including the last night, so no sleep before departure. 10 minute walk to Termini but location is right smack in the middle of embassy cluster, so armed guards are every where and there are relatively few places to eat in the immediate square block (Embassies generally have their own kitchen facilities, so staff does not pour into the street for lunch). Complimentary breakfast below standard for 4 star Europe hotels, but adequate. Hotel restaurant was nothing special and overpriced (but no more than virtually all Italian tourist hotels). Would recommend ONLY at bargain or 2 1/2 - 3 star rates.
