Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel In Rome.”
Reviews.Author: markwilson1957
Reviews.Content: My large group stayed here at the ArtDeco hotel on our way to a World Baseball Tournament in Nettuno. We were all very pleased with our rooms and service. Emanuele, who booked our group was there each day to make sure everything was perfect. The woman at the desk was always wearing a smile and had answers to everything presented to her...We were always helped with any questions and suggestions or directions for wherever we wanted to visit. They also booked tours and called taxis for whoever needed them. The breakfast in the morning was perfect to start out the day. The dinner at night was one of the best I had in my visit to Italy.....The price was right and the location was close to the terminal where you can reach anything in Rome from...

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and great experience”
Reviews.Author: chipchase
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for New Year celebrations 3 day trip. Bottle of wine on arrival after a walk from Termini. Police everywhere due to Embassy's and Legations felt very safe. Rooms a tad small but compensated for in many ways. Staff at Desk brilliant with suggestions of where to eat out. Great place near Colleseum tops. Dined with hotel New years eve, an extrordinary beutiful meal. Compelmentary fizz and plastic glasses to take out. Choose your square for entertainment. Billiant. Need to be fit for all the walking in Rome. Need to go back and will stay at Art Deco.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Art Deco great value for the price/location”
Reviews.Author: ltgdude
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our 5 days in Rome with my 15 year old daughter. I found this hotel on this site and I am very glad I did. The hotel is within a 10 minute walk of Termini and within a 5 minute walk of the Castro Preatorio metro stop. Our room was on the fourth floor overlooking the gardens of the convent next door. Across of the convent is the Turkish embassy. Next to the Turkish embassy is the Russian embassy, this is on Via Gaeto I believe. On the same street as the hotel but in the other direction is the British Embassy. Needless to say with these facilities nearby, it's a good neighborhood. There are always armed guards at the end of the street 24/7, The hotel has a complete American/british style breakfast with eggs, ham, bacon and all of the other usuals you expect from continental breakfast service. Perhaps the presence of the British embassy across the street plays a role in the breakfast they serve? At any rate, breakfast is also included in the price of the room. Freet internet access is available in the lobby. The art deco theme of the hotel is carried out throughout the property which creates a nice ambiance. In reviewing all of the write ups before we chose this hotel, we learned of the adult movie theatre that is just across from the hotel, to the north I believe? That did not disuade us from choosing Hotel Art Deco nor should it. I had completely forgotten about this until our third day there and we walked past it going back to the hotel. The theatre is not well marked by illuminated signage and if you don't know it's there, you won't notice it. I never noticed unsavory characters or a bad element hanging around. I am sure the armed guards at the other end of the block help in that regard :) Antonio and Gioi who work the front desk during the day bend over backwards to be helpfull. I think for the price and value and the quiet neighborhood with easy access to transportation, this hotel is hard to beat. Glad we chose it. Now it's time for bed to sleep off the jet lag. Ciao, Ltgdude

Reviews.Title: “Funky, clean, and safe”
Reviews.Author: syntaxed
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute and got a great deal. It's walkable from Termini, but easier to take the metro to the nearby stop. Great service (people at the front are extremely helpful), very clean, funky decor. Good breakfast (free espresso!) and feels safe due to the armed guards outside the nearby government buildings. We booked the triple, which was very large and even had a little courtyard. I guess the only (minor) annoyance was that the bathroom has a tub with a handheld shower head, but nothing to hold it, so you have to hold the shower head in one hand while trying to soap up with the other. Not a huge deal. Free internet on a computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: kostyalevin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Artdeco over a weekend stay in Rome. We selected the hotel primarily due to its location and the good price offered. The hotel is situated relatively near the Termini train station, but not too close to be affected by the unpleasant aspects associated with every major European train station. Safety in the area is definitely not an issue, as there are several embassies nearby, and you can see their armed guards from the hotel. The hotel is found in a very quiet side street, very close to a metro station (line B), which can take you to Circo Massimo. They don't offer parking, but we found a spot without too much trouble. Remember though: blue lines mean a pay spot, white lines mean free parking. There is a parking garage that the hotel works with, but they charge 30 Euros per night and they close at 0100. The hotel is an older building with early 20th century styling, but has been wholly modernized. Rooms have a retro look, as in their website, but our room was significantly less spacious than what I had expected. Having said that, it was sufficiently sized and not too small. What was too small was the elevator going to the fifth floor. My wife and I had trouble fitting in there with two small suitcases. Service was also quite helpful. In asking for directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. they were great! Wireless internet is provided for free. All in all, this is a good hotel, which provides good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect break”
Reviews.Author: sussexboy38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art Deco for four days, and we would have been happy to stay for much longer. It's very clean, the room was a good size, and the staff looked after us very well. I liked the way that room was tidied twice a day, and we had chocolates left in the room every afternoon. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Termini and with easy access to anywhere in the city that you want to go. Breakfast was good, we ate dinner there twice, and were not disappointed at all. When we go back to Rome we will stay at the Art Deco again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - could be better”
Reviews.Author: kbuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in September. It's not the best located hotel in Rome, but the price was right for me at the time. We booked a king size bed room, and while the room was ok and large, the area where the bed was was quite small. Breakfast was ok, but had to be there early otherwise you wouldnt get pastries! The hot chocolate was very good tho. I think what i didnt like was the location. After walking for hoooours i really dreaded having to walk all the way from the termini to the hotel. my feet usually complained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and staff but better value out there”
Reviews.Author: Dudleyman
Reviews.Content: Staff speak excellent English and are courteous and professional. The room was relatively small for two people (twin room) but clean, and I was disappointed that for a 4-star hotel room service didn't offer food in the evening (except coffee) and there was no tea/ coffee or ironing facilities either, and the on-demand TV/film services didn't work at all during our 3-day stay. The hotel's about 10 mins walk from Termini station but not central to attractions, but a little walking never killed anyone, though literally around the corner was an adult cinema and a strip bar(!) but we never encountered any "undesirables" in the area, and there's an excellent homely family run restaurant a couple of minutes away. All taken into consideration, I was a little disappointed with the stay there (for the price, and because it was touted as a 4-star hotel). There's nothing inherently wrong with the place and addressing the points I mentioned and dropping it to 3 star and knocking 35 euros off per night would be more appropriate in my view. I'd recommend the hotel, but with above reservations.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise - low-key neighborhood, easy access to all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: RJTA
Reviews.Content: Not knowing Rome very well, we were a little wary of this neighborhood until we got there. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it's bustling during the day, quiet at night, with enough restaurants nearby to keep you happy, and some of Rome's finest museums within walking distance. The hotel keeps to the artdeco theme throughout, but with a decidedly modern touch - rooms lack no convenience, breakfast area is light and welcoming (with a good assortment f choices). The staff was a bit cool, but helpful when needed and certainly able to handle basic requests with ease. The restaurant is better than average and seems to draw a fare number of locals for lunch (always a good sign). If you're staying at the ArtDeco or just in the neighborhood, have dinner at La Famiglia (just a few blocks away) - fabulous antipasti table, friendly service, and marvelous pastas!

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic007
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel. Convenient location - walking distance from Termini Train Station & also a metro stop. I've read that the area can be seedy, but I thought it was fine. I never heard any noise & I never saw any "bad types". In fact, there are consulates around the hotel area & there are soldiers placed on most street corners, creating a feeling of safety. The room was moderate size (maybe a bit tight for a couple, but I could have had a single size room, not double.....not sure), neat, modern, comfortable, clean & quiet. Windows were double glazed. Air con worked well. Staff were always very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was typical of european hotels - simple but plentiful. Free computer access in lobby. Hotel allowed me to check in early at about 8:30am. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant single room”
Reviews.Author: Millefleurs
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at Hotel Art Deco in a single room, as I was travelling alone. When travelling alone, one gets used to being accommodated in shoebox sized rooms. To my great pleasure, my room at Hotel Art Deco was a fair size, considering that it is a 19th century building in Rome. It was located on the first floor, approached by a flight of stairs (though I believe there is an elevator in the building). The decor was attractive, the room was spotlessly clean, there was a flat screen TV, and a really decent minibar. Antonio and the rest of the reception staff speak English well, and are courteous, pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I experienced in Italy. The luncheon buffet was also very good, at a fixed price of 8 euros, it was great value for money. There are many restaurants in the general vicinity, and plenty of cheap food options in Termini. There is also a drycleaners/laundry with internet terminals about two blocks away. The hotel has an internet terminal in the foyer which I was able to use for short periods with the permission of the reception staff. The location of Hotel Art Deco is particularly quiet. Although within walking distance of Termini, it is a reasonably upmarket section of town. There are two embassies very close by, and there are carabinieri parked in the streets 24/7, keeping watch. This means that the streets are reasonably quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: dugill
Reviews.Content: What with the Rome marathon and Scotland playing Italy, I couldn't get into my first choice hotel. However, I was not disappointed with this hotel. It is very central for the Termini station, metro and buses, and an excellent location to walk to all the major attractions. The Hotel itself was spotless and the staff were all friendly. The buffett breakfast was a treat. Scrambled eggs and bacon, cereal, a range of pasteries and breads and good strong coffee. Set you up for the day ahead. Our hotel room was a decent size and had a modern flat screen TV with satalitte. Tea and coffee making facilities are provided in the room free of charge but you do need to contact reception and they will bring it up for you. A well stocked mini bar is also provided and the prices did not seem too extreme. My only disappointment was the fact that our room only had a shower not a bath. That said, the shower was powerful and had constant hot water. I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel and have already recommended it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Nicely tucked away”
Reviews.Author: philyrobo
Reviews.Content: Having read a few reviews I was a little worried about having booked here, but all of these fears where soon washed away. We stayed for 4 nights, arriving on the friday (earlier than check-in, the room was ready for us). Everything in rome is relatively close, all walkable and the metro is pretty good to be fair. As such the hotel is nicely situated as it's in a pretty quiet area away from the hustle and bustle (roman roads make traffic pretty noisy). Following the via septembre (2 mins away from the hotel) will lead you back to all of the major touristy spots (down to barberini and on to trevi, spanish steps etc). The hotel itself is pretty basic, rooms arent huge but they are clean and adequate. With going in february/march the temperature wasnt such an issue but it was still pretty warm even then, air con didnt seem great (but that might not have been on given fully given the time of year). Breakfast was a simple continental breakfast, tea, couisant, cereals etc ... what was good is that it was server until 10:30 (which when youve done a lot of walking the day before (not to mention a wine or two can be a godsent). Theres a few places around, but we liked the caffe bar, if you head up via castelfinardo to the top and its just accross the road on the left. Station is nice and handy for catching busses, but metro is so nice and easy it seems daft not to do. Only place not really walkable is the vatican (again we took a bus day 2 and metro day 4... metro was pretty quick). Piaza navona was definately our favourite hangout, and if your not a light sleeper I'd recommend trying around their for a great central hotel. Otherwise this hotel is practical and pretty nicely off the main drag, without being too far.

Reviews.Title: “Artdeco is a superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artdeco hotel in Rome for four nights. The hotel was great and the staff are english spoken, friendly and I was treated like a king by them. Superb American buffe breakfast. The rooms were small but very very clean. The hotel was very clean overall. Received an international newspaper every morning at the reception. Everything worked out just great for me. The hotel is in an quiet and great area of Rome and would really like to recommend it. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Great Value hotel. Family-friendly.”
Reviews.Author: MsEllen88
Reviews.Content: Located just behind the British Embassy, the Art Deco is a small quiet hotel a few blocks from Termini Train Station, but definitely NOT in the seedy part of town. The hotel is part of the Best Western chain, and it doesn't resemble a chain hotel in that the art deco themes are different in each room. We stayed in a triple room, and although it could have been a bit more spacious, it was clean and quiet. This is a good location that is a short walk to Piazza Republica and the Via Veneto, and close to bus and subway stops that will take you just about anywhere. The 492 bus stops a block or two from the hotel and takes you directly to the area of Largo Argentina (near the Pantheon, Campo dei Fiori and Piazza Navona) and ends at St. Peters and the Vatican museums. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, and they will book restaurants and tours for you. There was FREE internet from a common-use computer in the lobby, and the breakfast, although simple, was very nice. The Art Deco is not a luxury hotel, so don't expect plush bathrobes or premium soap. You can expect a clean, quiet room in a safe part of town at a great value. N.B. There are some comments on Trip Advisor warning that there is an adult movie theatre and strip bar around the corner. While this is true, you won't even know it is there. The location is NOT a red light district. The Ministry of Justice and several Embassies are also nearby, so the area immediately around the hotel is completely safe. For wine lovers, I do recommend the Enoteca Trimani and Trimani Wine bar located 1 block away (corner of Cernaia and Goito streets). Trimani is one of the BEST wine shops in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, good service, a tad shabby”
Reviews.Author: dutchyankee
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend and enjoyed our stay. Comfy and clean room, large comfortable bed, quiet location, close to Termini station and metro station, nice neigborhood view, excellent flat-screen TV. Breakfast was simple American-style, fairly plentiful with long serving hours, fresh coffee and tea, and staff were attentive to our requests (though sometimes they seemed to be playing computer games or IMing quite a lot!). Request a coffee/teamaker for your room if you like hot drinks at night. A few complaints: the room was a bit shabby with a faint sewage smell emanating from the bathroom at times; the shower was either very warm or hot but not _really_ hot; but these were fairly minor. We had some problems getting Best Western's supposed 'price guarantee' and had to deal with various levels of customer service, but got the lowest price in the end. However, the upgrade request that we put in through the Best Western system was never transmitted to the hotel; seems like the communication between BW and the hotel mgmt. should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and sunny like Italy”
Reviews.Author: Ksusha
Reviews.Content: Small, sweet and sunny hotel soaked with Italian spirit. My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights in nice, large enough room with 3 windows. The room was on 4th floor in the corner of the building. The hotel is good choice for travelers. Very convenient location: on the one hand, it is not far from train station, on the other, it is very calm and secure district. Next time I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigone1963
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the english embassy(end of the road) On arrival after check- in the receptionist gave a map pointing out where all the tourist spots were which was very helpful. The room was spotless complete with a complementary bottle of wine . A safe in the room to store valubles. Breakfast consisted of coffee/cappuccino/espresso(etc) & tea. cereal, scrambled egg,bacon. ham,3 different cheeses,2 different kinds of cake. a good evening meal selection.quality at reasonable prices - Not able to comment because 10 mins walk from the city centre, loads of good eating places. Pretty central to the famous sites ie 20 mins walk from the Fontana di Trevi. 30 min walk from the Colusseum. The main train station is only 5 mins walk away along with the Metro. A trip to the Vatican then the use of the Metro is recommended costing 1 euro in both direction(2 euro's return) and the station Cipro (For the Vatican museums) (If you are NOT on an organised tour of the Vatican do not take the first cue you see when climbing the steps-wrong cue...) as the walk would take about 60-80 mins from the hotel. Overall an excellent hotel,friendly and helpful staff Worth noting: In the same block as the Hotel ArtDeco is"No limits" strip bar and a"sexi-movie" cinema which causes no problems. An excellent choice of hotel - Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Simply loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gengirl11
Reviews.Content: The art deco is just a great hotel at a really reasonable price. The rooms are more spacious than any others I have experienced in Europe and the staff go beyond to make sure you enjoy your stay. We arrived at 8am on check in day hoping to leave our bags with the concierge. The hotel had our room made up within half an hour of our arrival. I have already booked more time at the Art Deco because it felt like home. Australians - don't be confused about the best western thing. It is a much higher standard than I would expect from local best westerns. The bathrooms were clean, large, airy and nice decor. The breakfast was superb. The only thing I that some travellers may not like, is it is a fair walk to Trevi Fountain etc. This was good for us as we didn't want to stay in thre busiest part of Rome. It is a short walk to Termini station and from there you can buy a day ticket for 4 euro and go wherever you want. In terms of restaurants there are many great choices on the via palestra.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: stevie1
Reviews.Content: Although close to Termini, far enough to be away from the general ugliness and usual train statio related issues. Located on a nice quiet street, opposite the British embassy, the hotel is accessible via both Metro lines (Repubblica & Castro Pretorio) as well as several useful bus routes (especially, no. 62). Staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful. Our room was one of the large corner ones (two on each floor) so cannot complain about lack of space. Loved the antique Art Deco furniture! Bathroom spacious, modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location; small overpriced room”
Reviews.Author: sftemp
Reviews.Content: In a nice area, very close to the Termini station, but away from the noisier, dirtier streets - so location perfect. I booked a single room for a weekend for 157 euros per night, so was expecting something nice. However, the room was tiny. Bathroom was small but fine. No idea if double rooms are much larger. I guess you're paying for the location. It's just a hotel affiliated to Best Western. Nothing wrong with the place at all, but was expecting a much nicer, less cupboard-like room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Italy”
Reviews.Author: Shelleythewanderer
Reviews.Content: After hearing horror stories about hotels in Italy we were pleasantly suprised by Hotel Art Deco. The hotel decor was Art Deco themed but cute. Rooms were comfortable and large by Roman standards. Bathroom beautiful; good fittings, large bath, bidet, etc. Full breakfast including in price; cheese, ham, eggs, criossants, yogurts, fruit, cake, tea coffee, juice etc. Definitely not gourmet but plenty of it. Free internet access & 24hour consierge helped. Located in a quiet area 5minutes walk from Termini station it was a great base to see Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is a lovely place.. Do not stay in your hotel room”
Reviews.Author: nassos
Reviews.Content: We came back from Italy this monday, and I could say that it was a nice hotel. I am not sure If I could ask for more, having in mind that we spent 660 euro each for a three night staying in Rome (including the air ticket) and that Rome is an expensive place to be... I travelled from Greece, Athens, and I am sure I could be helpful to anybody travelling these days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: sdpow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 14 May to 18 May 2006. Got to the hotel using the Leonardo Express Train from Fiumicino to Termini (the main train station). From Termini, it's about a 10-15 minute walk. Exit from the front of Termini and walk through the piazza to the main boulevard and hang a right. You'll pass through another piazza before reaching Via Palestro (about 5 blocks down). Make a left on Via Palestro. It'll be about 2 blocks up on the left hand side. There are a number of hotels in the area, so you're bound to see many other travellers lugging suitcases down the street. Quaint hotel. Spotless room, nice art deco decor. Well kept, decent sized bathroom. Front desk staff and breakfast room staff were very accommodating. As it is with many European hotels, the elevators were painfully small; barely fitting two people comfortably, much less luggage. Breakfast was very good. Deli meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, scrambled eggs, juices, milk and coffee. Loved the location. Hotel was surrounded by embassies, so no need to worry about security. You're away from the hustle and bustle of the city, yet main attractions are still easily accessible by subway (Metro). Castro Pretorio metro station (Line B) is a 5 minute walk. (In May 2006, it was 1 euro for a single ticket or 11 Euros for a 3 day pass.) Line B will take you to Termini and the Colosseum (2 stops after Termini). When you exit the Colosseum metro station, the Colosseum will be directly in front of you. It's a breathtaking sight. At Termini, you can connect to Metro line A to get to Trevi Fountain (Barberini metro stop), Spanish Steps (Spagna metro stop) and the Vatican (Ottaviano metro stop). For under 200 euro, this is a good choice. I would not hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: silverlines
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel. The hotel was spotless. The buffet breakfast is also very nice. The staff were all courteous, spoke fluent English and were very helpful. When they found we were leaving at 5 am to get to the airport, they arranged a little take along snack for us. The bed was a bit hard, but everything else was great. Only a 5 minute walk to the subway. There are subway stops at/near all the major sights. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All the staff at Art Deco are superb”
Reviews.Author: ubiquity
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I take groups here every year. They range from mostly kids to mixed group of kids and adults. All the staff is wonderful and very helpful. They are also very patient. This hotel deserves the best hotel award! Tom Ubiquity International

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacksonsSurrey
Reviews.Content: We returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel last Sunday so I am wrtiting this review whilst everything is still fresh in my mind. We have been to Rome several times and this is one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. Yes it is a bit far from the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona and the other tourist locations but this is made up for by the fact that it is a safe and quiet location. It is just across the road from the British Embassy and other Embassies are close by so the area is extremely well policed by the carabinieri. Termini station is a 15 minute walk and the metro is 5 minutes away. As of last weekend a taxi from Piazza Spagna to the hotel cost 9 euros. The street itself is very quiet even though Termini station is very close. The hotel is very attractively decorated in the deco style and is extremely clean although it is not impersonal as many chain hotels can be. The staff were all courteous, spoke fluent English and were very helpful. When we had a small problem with the bathroom plumbing it was rectified immediately. Our room was very spacious, recently refurbished and at the end of a corridoor so that there was no noise. We can highly recommend this hotel as a little oasis in bustling, noisy Rome. A handy hint for those arriving at Ciampino Airport. A return ticket for the coach to Termini station costs just 13.5 euros each. This service is run by Easyjet as well as several other airlines and tickets can be purchased at the Airport. I bumped into a couple who had been charged 80 euros from Ciampino to our hotel - the correct fare is about 40 euros. This is a great hotel from which you can enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September. We really liked this hotel, it has a good location, near the metro station Castro Pretorio and the Termini station. You can easily reach the main attractions of Rome, Collosseum, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Treps. One day we had an excursion, the bus was leaving at 7 am and breakfast is only served from 7 am til 1030 am. But it was no problem for us to have our breakfast a bit earlier. It was a buffet, with croissants, little breads, cornflakes, fruit, yoghurt, orange juice, coffee,tea and more. There was jam, cheese, bacon, scrambled eggs,plum cakes and pie. It was very good to have a proper start of the day. Our room was well furnished, a bit small but everything was clean, also the bathroom was very clean and tidy. Everyday we got new towels and new soap. Outside it was very noisy on the streets but in the hotel you could hardly hear anything, I slept like a princess :-) We really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: WStradlater
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Rome and I was happy with the Art Deco. For those arriving at the Termini rail station it is an easy 5 - 10 min stroll. You can avoid a taxi. I was pleasantly surprised at how nicely the hotel was furnished and it looked spotless. The staff at reception were very friendly and spoke great English. On our last night a very helpful young lady phoned around a dozen restaurants to get us a booking. We had a splendid evening that night on the rooftop of the Hotel Bernini. The breakfast room and food is very good. We had a triple room and were a little disappointed to find the third bed was a fold-away, but the room was very large with a spa bathroom and its own lovely private courtyard so we didn't complain. The room was in the basement and there was a slight musty smell in the corridor but not in the room. The a/c worked a treat and the room was truly whisper-quiet at night. The hotel location is a bit out of the way but close to the underground and bus routes. We didn't find the location a problem at all and in fact walked to most things. The street is quiet at night and there are quite a few good places to eat nearby (Bistro Ristorante on the same Via Palestro and Girarrosto Fiorentino a few blocks away are recommended). For the price the Art Deco is nice little stylish oasis in bustling Rome. It has a spacious feel but without the impersonality of a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While one probably has nothing to complain about given the quality - price ratio of hotel rooms in Rome (and much of Continental Europe) I must say that my single room at Art Deco was rather small (perhaps that is what you get for Euro 120, B and B). I have indeed been to bigger rooms - in this I include school and college rooms I lived in - rather than 5 star hotels. On the whole, the hotel is not bad (and double & triple rooms are adequately sized from what I could see from my sneak peaks at cleaning time). It is clean, the breakfast is OK and the staff are, on the whole, decent. Also, the street the hotel is in is very quiet and safe as embassies and police abound. The location is a bit of a trek from the 'epicentre' of Rome (15-20 minutes) but the proliferation of busses/ taxis should make up for this for those who don’t wish to walk too much. For those who wish to see the famous Bernini and Boromini churches, the location is perfect – the majority of the most famous churches being ‘down the road’ from the hotel. People going there in April and even possibly May, may find it that the air conditioning is not on, especially in April. This month is still considered as cold by the Romans (not a hotel lie for I’ve seen many Italians dressed as one would dress in January in London) and so there is heating but no air conditioning. Overall impression is that in Rome, really, there isn’t much choice – you either get this, other alternatives are either the very cheap places of, possibly, dubious nature or Euro 250/300 + (semi) luxury hotels in the 'downtown' area close to the Spanish steps, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice!”
Reviews.Author: KahunnaTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in early November, 2004. Located in a residential neighborhood that includes embassies, the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the main train station (Termini). The hotel and rooms are nicely decorated in an art deco motif. The rooms are quite large and nicely appointed. The guest lounge has free newspapers available and is enabled for wi-fi internet connection. The staff is multi-lingual, courteous, and very helpful. The breakfast buffet is quite generous and a good start to the day. In the surrounding neighborhood are some interesting restaurants, 2 supermarkets (great places to get salami, cheese, bread, and wine for a picnic lunch each day), a coin laundry, and an internet cafe. I will both recommend and rebook this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 night Oct 22-25 2004. We really liked this hotel. Large rooms, large bathrooms, friendly & helpful staff (spoke English), elevator, and great breakfast. It was a great hotel. We were surprised by the size of the room.. heard stories about small European hotel rooms... this had US sized rooms. Only 2 downfalls: shower/tub combo only had handheld shower head. 15 min walk from Termini, not too bad but with luggage was a bit of a walk probably should have taken a cab. There was a great restaurant close by Ristorante al 39 (a block to the left of hotel on same road) had wonderful pizza and pasta... food was excellent and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: chanpatr
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively small hotel but the rooms were generous in size. As the hotel name suggests, the decor of the hotel is Art Deco. Our room was well maintained but renovation is due. The wallpaper was just starting to peel off from the wall. I would have to say the main feature of the hotel is the lift ... it's really small and quite an experience to try. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from the train station. As most of the tourist attractions in Rome are all located in the downtown area, you can pretty much walk to all of them within 40 minutes with the Vatican City being the exception. The staff at this hotel is very attentive. They will offer to take up your luggage for you and will provide you assistance in booking your excursions in and about Rome. Complimentary breakfast is provided to hotel guests each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SammyK5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this small hotel, that is a bit off the beaten path in Rome, but located fairly near the Termini (main) train station, bus routes and restaurants. How nice to come back to the room after a full day of sightseeing and take a hot bath in the jacuzzi tub in our room. The staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful, the room was quiet and well appointed, and the breakfast included with the room had a variety of hot and cold items.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Artdeco
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro 19, 00185 Rome, Italy
